transcript:
spine. But the mere thought of being afraid roused him again. "I cannot be afraid," thought he, and dis- mounted slowly among the guns. He delivered the order and did not leave the battery. He de- cided to have the guns removed from their positions and withdrawn in his presence. To- gether with Tushin, stepping across the bodies and under a terrible fire from the French, he attended to the removal of the guns. 
"A staff officer was here a minute ago, but skipped off," said an artilleryman to P
